comments.commentBody:
Yes, and a great deal of the middle class have been misinformed. The Democrats do not know how to grab the attention of people and explain things in a simple, personal way that will change the agenda and unite the people.

Many people in the middle class think that unions just take money from them, that they are forced to join and they don't see the benefits. I don't know what it's like in WI but in NY, I see many benefits to being a union member working for the city. It's a humble job, a moderate but steady income and good benefits that my union fights for day in and day out. How is it that middle class people resent unions?

Union leaders need to reflect on this. They are doing something very wrong to alienate people who most need them.

EH, ad to the list the public servants you elect who vote themselves cushy welfare packages, not to mention all they money they make selling you out to corporations and lobbyists. With all due respect, the joke's on you with that remark.
@sw, how about some facts?  Teachers on ca have not had a raise for several years, and are not eligible for social security.

This shows even a liberal state can go "right" when confronted with an over reach of living well on other people's money and when a sham recall is called for by libs.

Unions arent the solution anymore than bashing business or blaming bush is the solution to our woes.

We need to recognize we are all in this together and listen to and learn from both sides. I see nothing but bitterness from the libs...hardly a harbinger for bi partisanship which they claim is needed and play their blame on the tea party.

Look in the mirror.... and stop parroting MSNBC and democratic party talking points...its time to use your own mind and think hard where we can see a clear example of liberal policies making long term progress and success in a state of country.....is it Cali, NY, Spain, IL where is it?
"Corporate Criminals ' nice labels and stereotyping, is that what elections are all about ? Certainly to you.

Johnhw - it was in the fifties and sixties here in the USA when the WWII vets and their kids realized that there is more to life than me, myself and I. They funded the interstate highway system, medicare, and they found the money to go to the moon. and - guess what - taxes were pretty frickin high! And we were prosperous.

The republican anti-tax mantra pulls schoolbooks out of schools, lets roads turn to rubble, and keeps us way behind in everything from infant mortality to school test scores. Look at the schools in California if you want to save a few bucks on your taxes, and ask whether you want that.

Texas schools are doing right fine, aint' they? Well at least the kids can say "Honor the Texas Flag" for free.

Bitterness? what else made Lee Atwater tick? What animates Karl Rove or Rushbo?

Togetherness? pay your taxes and make the system work. Like your dad did.

If the differential is less than the # of absentee ballots (at least 206,000), then declaring the winner in this recall election must wait until they are all counted, on Friday.  In November, 1976 I was proud that my absentee ballot in NY State had to be counted, and made a difference, taking the White House away from the Watergate criminals called Republicans.  I made 104 get-out-the-vote calls to Wisconsin today, and learned of many absentees who voted early, against Walker.  Let us hope they prevail in this struggle against the corporate criminals in that State's administration, and that collective bargaining can be restored.  I love Wisconsin, where the term "progressive" was born and still has meaning, and where I do so hope the majority will follow the leadership of the people of Madison and do the right thing.
A great victory for Wisconsin and a great victory for America.  The world is starting to look better as of today.

Jeff: you are repeating the same old false charge, that money bought votes. How? The Walkers voters received cash?

They were convinced by TV ads to vote for him? If so, are you saying they are stupid, but the union voters are not?

Jeff,

Do you intend to stick to this line in the fall? According to the NYTimes, Obama is outspending Romney $172 million to $79 million so far on the election. Are you suggesting that Obama can buy the election, because you certainly seem to think that Walker did.

The best election results money could buy!  It's a clarion call to vote straight Democratic in the Fall.  The country most certainly does not go as the Dairy state goes.This curdled election is already in the rear view mirror

As a former Catholic, I truly appreciate your insightful look.   It's refreshing to read the perspective a women, Catholic women, who have such valuable observations to share.   Sister Farley speaks with remarkable clarity about the beauty of normal sexuality, same sex or heterosexual, and even alone sex.   As she notes, it is those who force or push themselves onto others who misuse sexuality and bring lasting harm to others, especially to those who are in a vulnerable place in life.
I'm not sure what brought on that last sentence, ntfr, because I'm pretty sure I said I liked the puzzle in my write-up, but the only response I can muster at this point is "Huh?"
A dozen #2s and one #1. Pretty good track record.
We should not be giving billions of dollars of military aid to the Pakistani armed forces. We are stupid.

How can you possibly equate the killing of innocent civilians with the killing of renowned terrorist. Your argument of moral equivalency is a joke.

Why do you comment on dead Palestinians (which I do not support, btw) without ever mentioning the far, far greater number of Muslim on Muslim murders?

Gee, unchndhart. It's been reported in major newspapers like the NY Times and Washington Post that drones are being used on our borders, and that local law enforcement has been requesting them. I'd be shocked if they are not now in use against the people of the U.S. All military technology is eventually used against our own people. But, "evidence?"  You can't see them, you can't hear them...guess they are just not there even in Afghanistan and Pakistan and Yemen and a bunch of other countries we don' know about.
What do you consider 911.  All the 'thunder' that has ensued since is a result of the gigantic strike on American soil.
It goes on until the end.

The mastermind of 9/11 was a Kuwaiti citizen who never lived in Pakistan. His parents emigrated to Kuwait. Pakistanis captured him and handed him over to the United States after he escaped Afghanistan. He was not a Pakistani and to use that as a leitmotif to justify the use of targeting innocents through drones is the most repulsive thing anybody could advocate for.

Yes, Pakistani leaders may be oblivious to the plight of their people, however Pakistanis are convinced that the unilateral use of drones is in stark contrast to the spirit of partnership. To use Osama as a straw-man to continuously browbeat Pakistan is in poor taste. You want to find flaws in other Pakistanis, then Pakistan can find a million flaws in NATO for what it has done over the last decade.

Yes, Pakistani government didn't know where Osama was! If you want regurgitate factoids just to satisfy your ego, then you're doing a great disservice to peace. And yes, most wanted people have been found in Pakistan, but that's because of the geography of the country. Under those circumstance, a spirit of partnership in required to solve problems. Not the unilateral use of lethal weapons just to prove a point.

The situation is getting utterly bizarre. If you don't want to thank Pakistan just because it blocked supplies for NATO since November, at least have the humility to acknowledge that Pakistanis allowed supplies for the first nine years. The air corridor to Afghanistan is still open for NATO!
So Drones are the war of the future?  No need for armies, navies, and airplanes!  This evolution is very troubling.
Give us an alternative course of action to combat militant Islam, or give me a break. If you need to bash America, and call our president a murderer please do it from somewhere outside our borders

We do not have on our planet an effective organization to punish those who commit crimes against society. The UN in my lifetime of 69 years has done little in the face of blatant atrocities.  After the holocaust, the only significance of "never again" is that the Jews in Israel will not allow a repeat of Nazi Germany in their country.  Other than that example, the rest of the world has stood by observing the media reports of one mass murder after another.  Given this base behavior, the actions of the USA, and its presidents is the lesser of two evils.  The only way I could agree with your statement is if someone with credibility were to do an in-depth study of the behavior of Al Qaeda and show that their actions have indeed been justified and that the Western media has grossly distorted the reality of the situations in the Middle East.  Trying to keep an open mind about the above is difficult, but I do realize from my own experiences that there is American propaganda.  I would hope that media from other countries would have stepped up to the plate to disclose such American propaganda if it existed to any significant degree. So far, that has not been the case.  I wish I were able to meet individuals throughout the Middle East to hear, first hand, their points of view.

This sort of action by the U.S. is illegal, immoral, and it reveals the president to be a ruthless murderer. It is so very American. And it is so very sad that so few people see it as a problem rather than as a solution.

We live in a global village. The best thing for us is to come to some agreement on how to get along. A legal document that presents people’s rights and liberties that people are obliged to live by and enforce. That way we get our private space and have a secure way of interacting.  Too some extend that constitution already exists by virtue of the two UN covenants. Our village is shaping up, we have no choice but to go forward and work to demilitarize the place and apprehend those who chose violence. The problem is with countries ruled by family or corporate dictators. Democracy has won the day. Killing people to hold on to power or to create some religious utopia marks the behavior of outlaws.
Only $1,000,000 on his head? Get real.

One American official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, described Mr. Libi as one of Al Qaeda’s “most experienced and versatile leaders,” and said he had “played a critical role in the group’s planning against the West, providing oversight of the external operations efforts.beats by dre

Ayman al-Zawahri, not wanting to end his life as just one more drone kill, is probably hiding in a Pakistani city now, like bin Ladin was. It's a safe bet for him since the chance of us sending in a Seal team again are almost nil, knowing that Pakistan would like nothing more than to spoil such a raid.

Welcome to the wonderful world of dance! As the mom of a 14-year-old competitive dancer, I've sat through many three and four hour long recitals.

This year, our studio's full recital had 62 numbers and over 220 dancers (yes, you read that right!). There are three shows over a Friday and Saturday -- younger dancers only, older dancers only, and all dancers.

It was brutal, and I don't begrudge the parent of any small child who feels the need to duck out before the end of the show. Hopefully your studio is savvy enough to schedule by age and can somewhat guarantee a full house for five year olds, who get a bigger thrill out of audience size than the 14 year old semi-pro, for whom recital is one of many, many performance opportunities.

What's wrong if some Governors love and prefer the chatter of gambling dens to the cacophony usually heard at the democratic market place? So if, the NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo, getting past his burdensome ethical concerns, for a change comes heavily on Unions, and unites with the casino gamblers, why should it look strange? Isn't the worldly life itself a big gamble?

I would rather say, "If you cannot afford to support a child in this world - DO NOT MAKE THE CHILD! (You know for sure what I mean, so hard challenging behaviour. It is so hard to be responsible for the natural consequences of our own acts). Self control is healthy, it has no cost, but it is not so funny.  About wealth and poverty, after reading many comments, I do not see anyone who mention that besides politics and dark market for pills, clean pills are too a big business. Pharmacy Industry sales all over the world. Does any one knows how much is the profit from the so-called emergency pills? Could that be, somehow, a good motivation for advertising and research?

Aborting a fully developed fetus is clearly the taking of a human life.  But what about the destruction of an embryo in its early stages (a morula, blastula or gastrula), when a human embryo is essentially indistinguishable from that of a dog or a rat? Accord a blastula the same status as that of a fully formed fetus and I believe you are thinking theologically. It's not simple science.  When it comes to theology, we need to respectfully agree to disagree.

I guess you didn't read the article, which cites studies showing that when the pill is taken post-fertilization, it has no effect on implantation rates.  So it's not clear what the basis is for your assertion that these drugs are "capable, in rare instances, of preventing implantation."  Furthermore, the manufacturers (and a lot of other people)  aren't really arguing that the pill is less effective than first thought.  Rather, they want the pill's packaging to more accurately reflect the mechanism that makes the pill effective in the first place.
